v Research Experience

16S Amplicon Research: 2015-present

University of Oregon, Institute of Ecology and Evolution: Dr. Brendan Bohannan

á       Analysis of 16S rRNA gene amplicon data collected from rainforest, pasture, and secondary growth forest from the Amazon using Qiime and R software

á       Comparison of relative OTU abundance measured against various clustering, reference and normalization techniques

á       Calculations of alpha and beta diversity estimates coupled with temporal data to investigate changes in microbial composition over time

Field Study - Deep-Sea Hydrothermal Vent Metagenomics: 2015

Portland State University, Woods Hole Oceanographic Institute, GNS Science

á       Month-long NSF-funded collaborative research expedition aboard the R/V Roger Revelle to collect hydrothermal vent samples in the Pacific Ocean off the coast of Tonga

á       Data collection and sample processing for metagenomic, transcriptomic and biochemical analysis

á       Transcription of sample collection dive notes

á       Public outreach via composing posts for expedition blog

Undergraduate Research Thesis: 2014-2015

Portland State University, Center for Life in Extreme Environments: Dr. Anna-Louise Reysenbach

á       Wrote and received two separate competitive grants for this study resulting in $14,400 project funding

á       Microbiological research on the characterization of a novel thermoalkaliphilic bacterium

á       Utilized studies of growth rates, substrate utilization, and 16S rRNA phylogeny in order to support hypothesis of novel species

á       Scientific article in preparation for publication to the International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

Research Assistant Ð Microbial Ecology: 2013-2014

Portland State University, Center for Life in Extreme Environments: Dr. Anna-Louise Reysenbach

á       Anaerobic thermophile culturing techniques

á       DNA extraction, amplification, quantification and processing for Sanger sequencing

á       Chemical inventory management
